content.value:
La Quinta is located on Carrera 5 between Calle 12B and Calle 12C, in La Candelaria, historical and cultural centre of Bogotá, and its main pride and tourist attraction. This neighbourhood characterises for its colonial and republican architecture houses, many of which have been declared sites of cultural and historical interest. It has a significant population of artists, teachers and students. Around here you will find the main touristic attractions: Cerro de Monserrate, Museo del Oro, Museo Botero, Plaza de Bolivar, and several coffee shops, galleries, bookstores and bars.

All of our private rooms are equipped with a closet, desk, night table and chair, so you can enjoy some rest or do some work if needed to. Our dorm rooms have private bunk beds, meaning each bed is isolated from light and noise by wooden walls. In addition, each bed is equipped with an electric plug and a light, you can enjoy some privacy inside your bed or share with the others in the room or common areas.All the rooms have free WiFi access and the price includes free breakfast.

description.description: Hostel in Bogota’s prime location, La Candelaria, La Quinta it's a place full of quietness and privacy, but also brings the opportunity to guests to share with other people when they desire to. The house has 21 rooms, 2 big kitchens, a patio, a TV room and several common areas. It has a living room and dining room on each floor, and it has privacy in both the rooms and the common areas. We thrive to offer more than an accommodation, creating a temporal home for our guests and offering them an educational experience on the Colombian culture and the cultural diversity of Bogotá.
